H0.text: The troposphere is the part of the atmosphere where greenhouse gases trap heat.

H1.text: Thermosphere is the part of the atmosphere in which greenhouse gases trap heat.

H2.text: Lithosphere is the part of the atmosphere where greenhouse gases trap heat.

H3.text: Stratosphere is the part of the atmosphere in which greenhouse gases trap heat.

A4.text: The large amount of CO2 in the atmosphere together with water vapour and sulfur dioxide create a strong greenhouse effect, trapping solar energy and raising the surface temperature to around 740 K (467 Â°C).

A5.text: The increase of air temperature at stratospheric altitudes results from the ozone layer's absorption and retention of the ultraviolet (UV) radiation that Earth receives from the Sun.
